labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: other ways to complete authorization step
issues.author: liuchunchi
issues.body:
other ways to complete authorization step (7.1.3 of {{RFC8555}}): a. Pre-authorization (authz) b. External (RATS) account binding. These can allow background-check model of RATS. 

In mode a, the Server is a Verifier and the Client is the Attester. The authz process contains RATS process?

issues.title: Exact format of "rats" identifier value
issues.author: liuchunchi
issues.body: In other words, a string that uniquely identifies a rats output?  URI? hash of EAT? Others...

issues.title: different meaning of "rats" identifier
issues.author: liuchunchi
issues.body: Should "rats" identifier represent only an attestation result (hash or EAT, eat_nonce, ...), or a RATS attester identity (ueid, ...)?  As for -00, it only represents an attestation result.

comments.author: liuchunchi
comments.body: or permanent-identifier as suggested by bweeks and mike

issues.title: keyAuthorization string validation process
issues.author: liuchunchi
issues.body:
1. the original keyAuthorization string is token concats '.' concats base64url(Thumbprint(accountKey)). 
In this draft, I replaced Thumbprint(accountKey) with attestationResult, no hash, which lacks a proof of possession to the accountKey, and attestationResult is plaintext. 

Should we construct a proper JSON/JWS Object, where the payload contains the attestationResult?
